me.timothy.loansbot

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.timothy.loansbot.Database

  • public class Database
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the connection to the MySQL database, both for remembering loans and remembering reddit Thing fullnames so they are not parsed multiple times.

    This class connects with 1 database, but may be reused by multiple calls to connect. Every public member function interacts with the underlying database. This class is NOT thread-safe.
    Author:
    Timothy

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect(java.lang.String username,
           java.lang.String password,
           java.lang.String url)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Connects to the specified database. If there is an active connection already, the active connection is explicity closed.
        Parameters:
        username - the username
        password - the password
        url - the url
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a sql-related exception occurs

      • ensureTablesExist

        public void ensureTablesExist()
                       throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates any necessary tables if they do not exist (as if by CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS).

        This does not ensure that the tables are in the correct format if they already exist.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a sql-related exception occurs

      • addLoan

        public void addLoan(Loan loan)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates a new loan with the specified information. loan is updated to reflect the new loan id. A new loan entry will be created each time, regardless of if a similar entry already exists in this database. The loans old id is ignored.
        The statement is prepared, and thus safe from SQL-injection.
        Parameters:
        loan - the loan
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a sql-exception occurs

      • payLoan

        public void payLoan(Loan loan,
           int amountPennies)
             throws java.sql.SQLException
        Pays the specified loan by incrementing amountPaidPennies by amountPennies. This does not verify that amountPaidPennies is greater than amountPennies.

        The statement is prepared, and thus safe from SQL-injection.

        This does not modify loan to reflect the new amount paid
        Parameters:
        loan - the loan, WITH a loan_id (so it must have been returned by either getLoansWith or used in addLoan)
        amountPennies - the amount in pennies to increment amountPaidPennies
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a sql-related exception occurs

      • getLoansWith

        public java.util.List<Loan> getLoansWith(java.lang.String concernedParty)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Checks for any loans with concernedParty as the lender or borrower
        Parameters:
        concernedParty - the concerned party
        Returns:
        a list of loans (not null) containing concernedParty
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if a sql-related exception occurs

      • getLoansWith

        public java.util.List<Loan> getLoansWith(java.lang.String borrower,
                                java.lang.String lender)
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gets loans with the specified borrower and lender
        Parameters:
        borrower - the borrower
        lender - the lender
        Returns:
        Loans (not null) containing borrower as the borrower and lender as the lender
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
